name: BEST WESTERN Clifton Park

reviews.text: Hotel booked for me by third party; otherwise, I would have stayed closer to destination or at the Hampton Inn or Hilton Garden Inn. Lots of trucks parking across multiple spaces, lots of contractor's with 4x4 pick ups...it's that kind of place. The room was fine. Microwave and refrigerator, two luggage stands, small closet. Breakfast is silly and not appetizing, but the woman staffing the small room is friendly and helpful. I will be returning later this month, which does not thrill me, but also does not bother me greatly. Meh.
reviews.title: It's a Best Western

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing this place has going for it is the location. We bid $87 on Priceline and this is what we ended up with. There are far nicer places in the area. The hotel looks like a complete dump from the outside. The inside is a bit nicer but smells of smoke. Didn't use the hot tub/pool area, as it was located right in the lobby and didn't afford much privacy. Breakfast is the typical complimentary fare, which means a total carb-fest with no protein in sight other than microwaved eggs. No thanks. My biggest complaint is the inability of the staff to quiet down a group of student athletes who awoke very early and sat in the lobby right outside our room for what seemed like two hours. Actually, we were initially awoken by a group of loud, drunk kids coming home at 3 A.M. This place seems to attract that element. Staff is young too and didn't seem to care. If you're going to stay here, don't accept a room on the first floor. Overall, it served it's purpose, as we weren't there to hang out but next time we'll spend a little more for something nicer.
reviews.title: Average at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maybe it's because my husband and I stayed here the Friday of Labor Day weekend, but we felt to spend over $150.00 for a basic room wasn't a good value. The front desk staff appeared tired and not outgoing. The room only had a queen bed, we thought it had a king. The room size was OK. We stayed in this same hotel the Friday of Labor Day weekend last year too, and the price was much more reasonable, our room had a king bed, and the bathroom had a 2 person tub, so the room this year was a disappointment to me.
reviews.title: Pricey for room

reviews.text: The room did have a microwave, small coffee maker and refrigerator, which is always a nice addition. The mini coffee pot had individual "pod" packets that I had difficulty opening and ruined the first one. I thought I was tearing it along the "dashed tear line" and had shaken the packet first to get the filter to the bottom, but I messed it up somehow. There was a coffee pot (thermos) in the lobby at check in, so I could have gone down to get coffee, but I decided to try a second packet in the room and was successful.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: There were 2 folding luggage holders in the room, which I thought was very nice; I don't like placing my suitcase on furniture, the bed or the floor, so the luggage holder was perfect.
reviews.title: great staff, very accommodating

description: Come experience unbeatable customer service including a complimentary continental breakfast while staying at this Clifton Park, New York hotel. Centrally located in Upstate New York, the Best Western Clifton Inn offers a convenient location, friendly customer service and a variety of top amenities, all at an unbeatable rate.
